title: Tougher gun and protest laws for NSW likely to pass | ABC NEWS
description: Sweeping new laws are being debated in NSW as a response to the Bondi Beach attack. State parliament has been recalled before Christmas to introduce tougher restrictions on guns and protests. The bills are likely to pass as the Liberal party split with the Nationals to back the change. title: Hopes new Darwin-to-China flights will bring down domestic airfares | ABC NEWS
description: For the first time since the COVID pandemic, direct flights between Darwin and China have resumed. A development welcomed as a win for business and tourism in the Top End.  Over the past year the NT has also seen new routes added to Singapore and Malaysia, which officials say could help turn the territory's economic tides. Matt Garrick has this report for ABC News Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-22/nt-direct-flights-between-darwin-and-china-recommence-guangzhou/106158228   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: 20 Biggest Stories of '25 - Part Two
description: In part two of our countdown we have some fascinating stories. One Australian went to the precipice of greatness but stumbled at the last moment. A player poaching scandal involving two of Australia's biggest footy clubs. A generational talent arrived on the international stage. There was heartbreak for a famous Australian sporting family.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Russian general killed by car bomb in Moscow | ABC NEWS
description: A third Russian general has been killed on Russian soil in the past year year. Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov died after a bomb exploded underneath his car in a residential area in southern Moscow.  The 55-year-old was in charge of the Russian armed forces’ operational training. The Russian Investigative Committee is determining whether Ukrainian intelligence services orchestrated the attack.  Kyiv previously claimed responsibility for the assassination of Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov.  It is unclear whether the death will impact Ukraine peace talks in Florida.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-23/russian-general-fanil-sarvarov-killed-by-car-bomb-in-moscow/106172592  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Stephanie March on Gaza, autocracy and elephants | ABC News Daily podcast
description: ABC foreign correspondent Stephanie March has explored the tensions between elephant tourism in Botswana and the destruction the creatures bring to local communities.    She's brought us a glimpse of Gaza, where children live in tents and she's walked the streets of Georgia, as fears grow about the influence of Russia and a slide towards autocracy.    This week, Sam Hawley is joined by ABC presenters and journalists to discuss their best stories and interviews from 2025.   Today, Stephanie March from the ABC’s Foreign Correspondent program on her heart warming and heart breaking global stories.

title: Survivors slam Justice Department over heavily redacted Epstein files | ABC NEWS
description: 19 survivors have launched a scathing attack on the Justice Department over the delayed release of the Epstein files and its redactions in the documents.  Meanwhile, the US House of Representatives is set to vote on whether to hold Attorney-General Pam Bondi in contempt over her refusal to release documents the department currently holds in relation to the late convicted sex trafficker. title: Beekeepers on high alert as varroa mite spreads across South Australia | ABC NEWS
description: Beekeepers across South Australia are on high alert as a deadly parasite spreads across the state. Varroa destructor, commonly known as varroa mite, was first discovered in a beehive in South Australia's Riverland in September and has since been found in other areas across the state. title: Thailand, Cambodia to resume peace talks as China gets involved | ABC NEWS
description: Thailand and Cambodia are set to resume peace talks, as China pledges to take a more active role in resolving the conflict between the South East Asian neighbours. Exchanges of fire between Bangkok and Phnom Penh have killed dozens on both sides and displaced half a million people after the truce brokered by US President Donald Trump collapsed. title: Donald Trump recalls almost 30 diplomats over 'America First' agenda | ABC NEWS
description: The Trump administration is recalling nearly 30 ambassadors and other senior career diplomats to ensure embassies reflect its ‘America First’ priorities. Former US ambassador John Herbst says it’s “unusual” to recall a large number of diplomats but not necessarily surprising as the administration is yet to fully staff up all the key positions in the State Department. title: RV Investigator prepares for voyage to Antarctica | ABC NEWS
description: The CSIRO's research vessel the RV Investigator is about to embark on an epic voyage to the icy waters surrounding Antarctica.   It'll allow scientists to study a marine region close to a massive glacier that's vulnerable to climate change.
